title: AP Prep Course
question_text: Suppose at a large high school, the average AP test score for AP Statistics is $2.84$ with a standard deviation of $0.45$ . The school decided to offer nightly study sessions and randomly chose $30$ students to participate. These $30$ students averaged AP scores of $3.1$ . What can be said about the effectiveness of the AP study sessions?

choices.text: Nothing, since the design of the experiment was not done in an effective manner.
Nothing, since the sample size is too small to develop any reasonable conclusions.
The students in the study sessions did not perform much better than their peers; their effort is only 0.58 0.58 standard deviations above the mean of their peers.
